projects.problem: I found an opportunity to create a software as a service with eCommerce integrations after having integrated a previous client's website. We exposed their menu online and offered online payments and ordering.
projects.approach: I had to review the older codebase and note the modules that could be agnostic of any merchant information. I then analyzed the costs of operating the SaaS, which factors into how much I charge for the SaaS subscription and onboarding new clients.
projects.solution: I created a website to demonstrate the product, which includes a demo for the inventory, online ordering, and online payments features. The front-end is a template that can customized to match the brand of the business for quick deployment. The front-end then communicates with my SaaS API to handle the requests between the client and their vendor (e.g. Clover).
projects.results: Clients have reached out to me in my local town to get them setup with this product, which has allowed me to better understand their domain and how their specific businesses operate.

projects.problem: Client approached me to create a website for their new Landscaping business.
projects.approach: I gathered the requirements with the client, and reviewed the competition to see what was and was not working with their sites.
projects.solution: A website that displays the business's service offerings, mission statement, and how to contact them.
projects.results: Client was happy to get their website deployed, and is ready to collaborate again when the site needs to be updated.

projects.problem: Owner of Tierra Caliente needed an updated website for their restaurant to support their new business processes.
projects.approach: Reviewed old site and current business processes with stakeholders to determine direction of website and internal processes.
projects.solution: Organization of menu and processes to make the restaurant operate more consistently. Photos of menu items were taken to place on the new site. The new site also facilitates catering requests and online ordering. A reward system is also in the works
projects.results: Business owner and stakeholders were pleased with the new solution, and look forward to growing their business with the new technologies and processes.

projects.problem: Budgeting normally comes in the form of spreadsheets, but I wanted to create an app that makes it easy to add/remove income, expenses, and funds without having to manually adjust cells on a spreadsheet.
projects.approach: Looked at a typical Zero Balance budget sheet and broke it down into its smallest functional units, then determined the process for capturing and calculating the data to present a breakdown that is easy to digest.
projects.solution: An application that accepts input for financial items (e.g. an expense or income) and calculates the balances for each category and the final balance.
projects.results: Peers were happy to find the site intuitive and helpful since many of them were students with financial struggles.

projects.problem: I had some friends and acquaintances who were hesitant to spend money on any sort of exercise tracking application, so I wanted to create a simple and free one for them.
projects.approach: I looked towards other exercise applications and noted features, aesthetic, and other aspects I liked. When the application reached a testable state, I had users test the site to get feedback and bug reports.
projects.solution: Created an exercise tracker application with the following features: creating workouts, calculating effort, and viewing history.
projects.results: The application is functioning with basic features, but due to financial constraints, the back-end isn't the snappiest. Next steps are to work on additional features, such as: creating workout templates, logging food, and implementing a social aspect as well.

projects.problem: I needed a portfolio site to inform others about who I am, and showcase my projects and my resume.
projects.approach: I initially created a document outlining the content I wanted to display. Afterwards, I digitally sketched what the website would look like on mobile and desktop, which sort of doubled up as a sketch and a wireframe. Then I created mockups of the site utilizing the content in the document I mentioned earlier.
projects.solution: Utilized GitHub as repository and created site using Vue. I used Azure to host the site and Google Domains to customize the domain of this site.
projects.results: You're on the site now! You tell me!
